hook.text: Odysseus tied himself to the mast to resist the Sirens. That's the oldest pre-commitment device in literature.

buildup.text: Pre-commitment removes future choice. You decide now to constrain your future self's options.

discovery.text: StickK.com lets you bet money on your goals. If you fail, your money goes to a charity you dislike.

twist.text: It works because loss aversion is stronger than desire for gain. People hate losing more than they love winning.

climax.text: The best pre-commitment devices make the wrong choice painful and the right choice automatic.

punchline.text: Tie yourself to the mast before the Sirens sing.

quiz.question: Why do pre-commitment devices work?
options: Loss aversion makes failing painful enough to motivate action
